question: Virtual water trade is being looked at by experts as a solution to the worldâ€™s water crisis. What does virtual water (VW) imply?
option1: Volume of heavy water required to replace ordinary water
option2: Volume of water required to produce a commodity
option3: Volume of water saved by using rainwater harvesting
option4: Volume of water utilized by an effective flood control
answer: Volume of water required to produce a commodity
explanation: Virtual water. Virtual water trade (also known as trade in embedded or embodied water) refers to the hidden flow of water if food or other commodities are traded from one place to another. It refers to the sum of the water use in the various steps of the production chain.
